name: Western Bluebird
overview: The Western Bluebirds are small with short tails. Male Bluebirds are shiny blue with rust orange from their breast onto the upper back. While, Females are gray with pale orange on the breast with a hint of blue on their wings and tails. The throat is blue in males, while females have gray and their lower belly has a whitish color.
habitat: They are found in open woodland such as coniferous and deciduous. Also, they live in backyard, burned areas and farmlands form sea level far up into the mountains.
tags: Blue Bird Sialia Mexicana Western Bluebird birds animal animals
